name: Bengaluru International Short Film Festival
description: This year, the ants march in! Tiny. Tenacious. Timeless. Just like your short films!The15thedition of theBengaluru International Short Film Festival (BISFF)will showcase shorts from all over the world, creating a physical space for a great audience experience and bringing together a keen audience for the filmmakers. Like in the past, this edition will be presented in aHybridversion, having both Online and Venue Screenings.Online Screeningsare accessible onlywithin India, whileoffline screeningswill be presented atfivevenues across Bangalore.We are happy to hostBISFF at the Bhavan 16 and 17 August, 2025and screen films from the following sections:Queer Qorner CompetitionWomen's Collective CinemaKarnataka CompetitionIndian CompetitionGerman FilmsThehighlighton16 August,is the Indianpremiereof theGerman Short Filmscurated and presented byMaike Mia Höhne,artistic directorof theHamburg Short film Festival.Maike will also be in coversation with Marathi film director,Umesh Vinayak Kulkarnion"How to not enter European Film Festivals"at4:00 pm on 17.08.2025atSuchitra.Following the sucess and recognition of the short films produced from the first edition ofScript to Screen, we are delighted to have recieved 3 times as many application this time around. During the award ceremony onAugust 17, at Suchitra Cinema and Cultural Academy,grantees of the Script to Screen 2.0will be announced!Find the complete schedule here!BISFFwas conceived on a dream-fuelled evening with the idea to create a platform for young and amateur filmmakers to screen their shorts to discerning audiences and, more importantly, find constructive and critical feedback from experts in the field.BISFFis the only film festival in India which is accredited by the Academy Of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences as an official qualifying film festival for Live-Action.The 2025 edition ofBISFFis supported by theGoethe-Institut / Max Mueller Bhavan.

name: Making Friends in Germany
keywords: Tips for a Great Start in Germany
description: Would you like to make new friends and settle into life in Germany quickly? Then join our exciting info session! You'll get helpful tips and insights on how to settle into your new surroundings, connect with others, and better understand cultural differences.Don't miss out—we're here to support you in settling in!Date:Monday, 18.08.2025Time:4:15 PM - 6:30 PM ISTPlace:Goethe-Institut / Max Mueller Bhavan BangaloreLanguage of the Event:EnglishRegister hereLimited Seats, Registration will be closed once seats are full.DATA PROTECTIONPlease ensure that you've read and agree to the attached Data Protection Declaration.Data Protection Declaration AMIF(PDF, 218 KB)About the Project:This event is being offered within the framework of the AMIF Project - "Pre-Integration and Transition Management - Successfully navigating the migration process". This project supports people, who want to migrate permanently to Germany for professional or private reasons, in preparing for everyday and working life.

name: Interphew! - Tips and Tricks for Job Interviews in Germany
keywords: Learn what makes a great interview
description: In our workshop, you will learn what a great job interview should look like using real examples. We will look at the preparatory measures, the Dos and Don'ts  and the overall structure of the interrview, including the potential questions, so that you are aware of all the important details when interviewing in the future.Date:Saturday, 20.08.2025Time:5:15 PM - 7:30 PMPlace:Hall, Goethe-Institut / Max Mueller Bhavan BangaloreLanguage:English and German (B2 Level)Participation is free of charge.Seats are limited and you will receive a confirmation one day prior to start of the session.Register hereWe look forward to your participation!Whom is the course aimed at?The project is co-financed by the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund (AMIF) and is aimed at third-country nationals in Germany and those about to immigrate to Germany.
